title: Information Security Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Kentucky University
Interview Descriptions: Was a decent interview experience. Was told that I would hear back either way, but never did. I even sent follow up emails without any further communication. It would have been nice to be told that they chose someone else instead of waiting for over a month without knowing.
Interview Questions: They asked about my education, certifications, and cybersecurity knowledge.

title: Advisor for Student Athlete Success Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Kentucky University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple and not intimidating. They will ask you simple questions about your schedule and classes that you have taken because they want to know if you would be a match as a tutor with any of the athletes.
Interview Questions: The most important questions they ask are about your school schedule to see if you have the right availability for what they are looking for and also what classes you have taken. There are other positions that aren't tutoring so they will ask if you are interested in those as well.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Kentucky University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty easy and casual. It depends on the department, but it is usually a low stress interview. Depending on the department, you may need a CV but it really is not bad.
Interview Questions: What is one of thing you have difficulty with?

title: Web Maintenance Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had a zoom interview that lasted 15 minutes. The questions were non technical and straight forward. The zoom interview concluded with a job offer and a start/training time frame.
Interview Questions: How did you find out about this role?

title: Coordinator, Nationally Competitive Opportunities Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The interview included many questions specific to the job and several were situation questions - "describe a time you did [xyz]." For this specific position, there was a hiring committee with multiple people sitting in on the screening interview.

While I ultimately didn't get the job, the lead hiring manager was helpful and kind. I sent a follow-up email to ask, if she had the time, what feedback she could offer. She set up a phone call to give me feedback and constructive criticism, and she even sent me another job listing within the company. I was only expecting maybe a few short notes via email, but she went above and beyond to help me understand things I did well and things I could improve on.

As someone who is still somewhat new to the job search, I greatly appreciate this experience and the kindness and thoughtfulness the Office of Scholar Development at WKU extended to me. If this is how they take care of interview candidates, I know the care they take with their students must be phenomenal!
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to work with someone from a different organization/team.

title: Piano Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Kentucky University
Interview Descriptions: The first round zoom interview was welcoming, thoughtful, and respectful. Smiling faces and warm personalities. Not sure if will move forward or not yet. The email correspondence has also been very professional and kind.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself.
What types of technology will you teach with?

title: Assitant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Kentucky University
Interview Descriptions: set the meeting time slot; 30 minutes virtual interview; greeting; self introduction; introduction of school; teaching experience; research experience; publication; research sample; research plan; research; teaching ; teaching ; other questions;
Interview Questions: What's your further research plan

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Kentucky University
Interview Descriptions: Communication was great and direct.  I felt that the questions were engaging and thoughtful.  They got back to me quickly within the time frame they agreed to.  Compared to other interviews I've done, this interview was by far the best.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your interests.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Screening Interview.
Committee Interview.
Campus Tour.
Campus Presentation.
Recommender Interview.
Apply in Oct. Started first Interview in February. Offer in March.
Don't know what else to say to meet 30 words requirement. This is more than 30 words for sure. Stop telling me it is not 30 words.
Interview Questions:
Teaching Philosophy
Research
Grant writing
Questions related to your major

title: Chef Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: it was okay and they were very nice and i did not feel stressed and this is not true and i hate this requirement on glassdoor i just want to see everyone else's comments
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY)
Interview Descriptions: I met one-on-one with the department head. The environment was relaxed, and the questions were typical of any job interview. As far as interviews go, it was low pressure and a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Transportation Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I came in person to meet the professor in charge of the progress, reviewed my resume, and was asked a few general questions about my attitude towards the job. Afterwards, he mentioned he would like for me to join the team, and that as long as my background check passed, I would be welcomed on.
Interview Questions: What made you want to apply for this position? What do you find interesting about the projects available?

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It went on well. Everyone was respectful and pleasant.  The on-site interview was stress-free although I had to give a presentation in front of everyone. WKU is a great school to work at.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Assistant Track Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Kentucky University
Interview Descriptions: Quick interview over the phone, the whole process was very expedited as they needed someone immediately. I enjoyed the process overall and was very thankful to have been given the opportunity at Western Kentucky
Interview Questions: What is your coaching style

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very casual, asked about class schedule, how many hours I wanted, and if I was available on weekends. I just met with the supervisor and I was offered the job before I left the interview.
Interview Questions: Are you available on weekends?

title: Data Entry Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a multi-stage process for hiring new employees. The interview process typically includes the following steps: writing a job description, posting a job, scheduling interviews, conducting preliminary interviews, conducting in-person interviews, following up with candidates and making a hire.
Interview Questions: My past working experience

title: Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone interview - It was informal and provided an overview of the position. A few basic questions were asked.
2. Panel interview and tour - This was a little different than what I was used to. Everyone was very nice. Each person asked a question and then I was able to ask questions.

It took a few weeks to get the first call and then about a month or so to get an offer.
Interview Questions: Why are you an ideal candidate?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very group oriented. Lots of situational practices to see how you work with others. It was a two day process and the group processing day was very long and grueling.
Interview Questions: A resident is breaking (insert policy). How do you handle it?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: They had a group of full time on side of the table each with a set a questions.  They took turns asking me questions and follow up questions.  They mostly asked about my experience.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked with special needs populations before?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Skype Interview and On-Campus Interview. SKype interview was 15 minutes long and focused on general teaching methods and philosophy of education. On-campus interview included a dinner the night before, teaching presentation, and interview with the search committee. I was given a campus tour and asked to participate in a skills assessment. I watched a video of a pre-service teacher who was struggling during a formal observation. A professor pretended to be that student and I coached her.
Interview Questions: Why WKU?

title: Sport Administration Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a long two month process of filling out applications and getting into the masters program in order to be a Graduate Assistant. The interview is laid back and will ask you simple questions about your life and why you think you deserve to have the position.
Interview Questions: what time management skills have you possessed?

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is a long process. Once the application is completed candidates can be selected often times months after applying. The interview process is simple for non upper level management positions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Associate (Student Worker) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Fort Knox, KY) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview felt more like a formality as it was with the senior member at the regional office who also happened to be my counselor. After my name came up in the online application she contacted me by email and set up an interview.
Interview Questions: I was questioned about my experience managing teleconferencing equipment.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview for the graduate assistant position with Psychological Sciences. Some graduate programs require interviews but every department is different. If you are admitted into the master of science program, you automatically receive an assistantship position with the small amount of benefits going along with it.
Interview Questions: They did not ask any questions?

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions:
basic interview process
-filled out application
-called in for in person interview with the director
-proceeded to have 1 30-min to 1 hour (sorry it's a bit fuzzy) discussion about the job requirements and my ability to perform aforementioned requirements
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience working or dealing with high school students?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: There is an event called super saturday in which they mass interview students for the hiring process. It's a fun day where you can truly shine and meet future co-workers!
Interview Questions: What makes you a leader?

title: Part-Time Technology Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Apply through HR webpage. May take months to hear back. If chosen for an interview they will generally interview people one by one over 1-3 weeks and then make a choice within a few weeks after that. Interviews usually consist of you and a small committee of between 2-5 people.
Interview Questions: How would you define work ethic?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy. You have a one-on-one with a Residence Hall Director and another RA. They ask you questions about diversity, teamwork, and personality. Most of the questions are straight-forward. They were very nice and it was not stressful.
Interview Questions: Tell me about diversity.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy process. I met with the head of the program and the professor that I would be working with. They asked about my background and why I wanted to work in the program.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next five years?

title: Assistant Professor of Education Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions:
A phone call, which went pretty well, then a visit which was a total whirlwind. So much in a very short amount of time.

It would have been nice if they had asked or accommodated my dietary restrictions. Taking a strict vegetarian to a steakhouse was a colossal waste of time. That lack of flexibility and appreciation of diversity would be a hallmark of my WKU experience.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work at WKU.

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: interviewing process was wonderful, staff made you feel welcome, went through two interviews with the first being shown around and the second spending time talking with staff.
Interview Questions: What services would I add

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Kentucky University (Bowling Green, KY) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: My graduate studies department nominated me for the position. I wrote and submitted an application essay. The graduate studies department accepted my application and I had a phone interview for the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background.
